dashboard.description: Uploaded by https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/runbooks/-/jobs/558968577 at Tue May 19 13:24:41 UTC 2020

panels.description:
_Apdex is a measure of requests that complete within a tolerable period of time for the service. Higher is better._
  
### Component Thresholds  
_Satisfactory/Tolerable_  
 * rails_sql: 0.05s/0.1s

targets.expr:
min by (type) (min_over_time(gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{env="$environment", environment="$environment", monitor="global", stage="main", type="patroni"}[$__interval]))
or
min by (type) (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{environment="$environment", monitor!~"global|", stage="main", type="patroni"})

min by (type) (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{env="$environment", environment="$environment", monitor="global", stage="main", type="patroni"} offset 1w)
or
min by (type) (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{environment="$environment", monitor!~"global|", stage="main", type="patroni"} offset 1w)

panels.title: Latency: Apdex

panels.description: Error rates are a measure of unhandled service exceptions within a minute period. Client errors are excluded when possible. Lower is better

targets.expr:
clamp_max(
  max by (type) (max_over_time(gitlab_service_errors:ratio{env="$environment", environment="$environment", monitor="global", stage="main", type="patroni"}[$__interval]))
  or
  sum by (type) (gitlab_service_errors:ratio{environment="$environment", monitor!~"global|", stage="main", type="patroni"}),
  1
)

max by (type) (gitlab_service_errors:ratio{env="$environment", environment="$environment", monitor="global", stage="main", type="patroni"} offset 1w)
or
sum by (type) (gitlab_service_errors:ratio{environment="$environment", monitor!~"global|", stage="main", type="patroni"} offset 1w)

panels.title: Error Ratios

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.

targets.expr:
avg by (type) (avg_over_time(gitlab_service_ops:rate{env="$environment", environment="$environment", monitor="global", stage="main", type="patroni"}[$__interval]))
or
sum by (type) (gitlab_service_ops:rate{environment="$environment", monitor!~"global|", stage="main", type="patroni"})

avg by (type) (gitlab_service_ops:rate{env="$environment", environment="$environment", monitor="global", stage="main", type="patroni"} offset 1w)
or
sum by (type) (gitlab_service_ops:rate{environment="$environment", monitor!~"global|", stage="main", type="patroni"} offset 1w)

panels.title: RPS - Service Requests per Second

panels.description: Saturation is a measure of what ratio of a finite resource is currently being utilized. Lower is better.
panels.title: Saturation

panels.description: Percentage time the latency SLI for this service is within SLO
panels.title: 7d Latency SLA

targets.expr:
sort(
  max(
  ALERTS{environment="$environment", type="patroni", stage=~"|main", severity="s1", alertstate="firing"} * 4
  or
  ALERTS{environment="$environment", type="patroni", stage=~"|main", severity="s2", alertstate="firing"} * 3
  or
  ALERTS{environment="$environment", type="patroni", stage=~"|main", severity="s3", alertstate="firing"} * 2
  or
  ALERTS{environment="$environment", type="patroni", alertstate="firing"}
  ) by (alertname, severity)
)

panels.description: Percentage time the error ratio SLI for this service is within SLO
panels.title: 7d Error Rate SLA

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for this component within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.
panels.title: pgbouncer Component RPS - Requests per Second

panels.description: Apdex is a measure of requests that complete within a tolerable period of time for the service. Higher is better.

targets.expr:
sum by (component, type) (
  (avg_over_time(gitlab_component_apdex:ratio{component="rails_sql", environment="$environment", monitor!~"global|", stage="main", type="patroni"}[$__interval]) >= 0)
  *
  (avg_over_time(gitlab_component_apdex:weight:score{component="rails_sql", environment="$environment", monitor!~"global|", stage="main", type="patroni"}[10m]) >= 0)
)
/
sum by (component, type) (
  (avg_over_time(gitlab_component_apdex:weight:score{component="rails_sql", environment="$environment", monitor!~"global|", stage="main", type="patroni"}[10m]) >= 0)
)

panels.title: rails_sql Apdex

panels.description: Error rates are a measure of unhandled service exceptions per second. Client errors are excluded when possible. Lower is better
panels.title: service Component Error Rates

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for this component within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.
panels.title: service Component RPS - Requests per Second

targets.expr:
sum by () (
  rate(pgbouncer_stats_sql_transactions_pooled_total{type="patroni", tier="db", environment="$environment", stage="main"}[$__interval])
  or
  rate(pgbouncer_stats_queries_pooled_total{type="patroni", tier="db", environment="$environment", stage="main"}[$__interval])
)

sum by (fqdn) (
  rate(pgbouncer_stats_sql_transactions_pooled_total{type="patroni", tier="db", environment="$environment", stage="main"}[$__interval])
  or
  rate(pgbouncer_stats_queries_pooled_total{type="patroni", tier="db", environment="$environment", stage="main"}[$__interval])
)

panels.title: Estimated p95 rails_sql Latency - per fqdn

targets.expr:
sum by () (
  rate(pg_stat_database_xact_commit{type="patroni", tier="db", environment="$environment", stage="main"}[$__interval])
  or
  rate(pg_stat_database_xact_rollback{type="patroni", tier="db", environment="$environment", stage="main"}[$__interval])
)

sum by (fqdn) (
  rate(pg_stat_database_xact_commit{type="patroni", tier="db", environment="$environment", stage="main"}[$__interval])
  or
  rate(pg_stat_database_xact_rollback{type="patroni", tier="db", environment="$environment", stage="main"}[$__interval])
)

panels.description: Loadavg (1 minute) per core, below 1 is better.

targets.expr:
avg by (environment, type, tier, stage, fqdn) (node_load1{environment="$environment", stage="main", type="patroni"})
/
count by (environment, type, tier, stage, fqdn) (node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", environment="$environment", stage="main", type="patroni"})

panels.title: loadavg1 per core

panels.description: Loadavg (5 minute) per core, below 1 is better.

targets.expr:
avg by (environment, type, tier, stage, fqdn) (node_load5{environment="$environment", stage="main", type="patroni"})
/
count by (environment, type, tier, stage, fqdn) (node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", environment="$environment", stage="main", type="patroni"})

panels.title: loadavg5 per core

panels.description: Loadavg (15 minute) per core, below 1 is better.

targets.expr:
avg by (environment, type, tier, stage, fqdn) (node_load15{environment="$environment", stage="main", type="patroni"})
/
count by (environment, type, tier, stage, fqdn) (node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", environment="$environment", stage="main", type="patroni"})

panels.title: loadavg15 per core

panels.span:
Active db connection saturation per node.

Postgres is configured to use a maximum number of connections. When this resource is saturated,
connections may queue.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{environment="$environment", stage="main", type="patroni", component="active_db_connections"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: active_db_connections component saturation: Active DB Connection Saturation

panels.span:
Average CPU per Node.

This resource measures all CPU across a fleet. If it is becoming saturated, it may indicate that the fleet needs horizontal or
vertical scaling.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    avg(1 - rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", environment="$environment", stage="main", type="patroni"}[$__interval])) by (fqdn)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{environment="$environment", stage="main", type="patroni", component="cpu"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: cpu component saturation: Average CPU Saturation per Node

panels.span:
Disk utilization per device per node.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{environment="$environment", stage="main", type="patroni", component="disk_space"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: disk_space component saturation: Disk Utilization per Device per Node

panels.span:
Memory utilization per device per node.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{environment="$environment", stage="main", type="patroni", component="memory"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: memory component saturation: Memory Utilization per Node

panels.span:
Open file descriptor saturation per instance.

Saturation on file descriptor limits may indicate a resource-descriptor leak in the application.

As a temporary fix, you may want to consider restarting the affected process.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{environment="$environment", stage="main", type="patroni", component="open_fds"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: open_fds component saturation: Open file descriptor saturation per instance

panels.span:
Disk sustained read IOPS saturation per node.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    rate(node_disk_reads_completed_total{type="gitaly", device="sdb", environment="$environment", stage="main", type="patroni"}[$__interval]) / (60000)
or
rate(node_disk_reads_completed_total{type="nfs", device="sdb", environment="$environment", stage="main", type="patroni"}[$__interval]) / (15000)
or
rate(node_disk_reads_completed_total{type="patroni", device="sdb", environment="$environment", stage="main", type="patroni"}[$__interval]) / (100000)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{environment="$environment", stage="main", type="patroni", component="disk_sustained_read_iops"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: disk_sustained_read_iops component saturation: Disk Sustained Read IOPS Saturation per Node

panels.span:
Gitaly runs on Google Cloud's Persistent Disk product. This has a published sustained
maximum write IOPS value. This value can be exceeded for brief periods.

If a single node is consistently reaching saturation, it may indicate a noisy-neighbour repository,
possible abuse or it may indicate that the node needs rebalancing.

More information can be found at
https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/disks/performance.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    rate(node_disk_writes_completed_total{type="gitaly", device="sdb", environment="$environment", stage="main", type="patroni"}[$__interval]) / (30000)
or
rate(node_disk_writes_completed_total{type="nfs", device="sdb", environment="$environment", stage="main", type="patroni"}[$__interval]) / (15000)
or
rate(node_disk_writes_completed_total{type="patroni", device="sdb", environment="$environment", stage="main", type="patroni"}[$__interval]) / (30000)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{environment="$environment", stage="main", type="patroni", component="disk_sustained_write_iops"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: disk_sustained_write_iops component saturation: Disk Sustained Write IOPS Saturation per Node

panels.span:
Gitaly runs on Google Cloud's Persistent Disk product. This has a published sustained
maximum write throughput value. This value can be exceeded for brief periods.

If a single node is consistently reaching saturation, it may indicate a noisy-neighbour repository,
possible abuse or it may indicate that the node needs rebalancing.

More information can be found at
https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/disks/performance.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    rate(node_disk_written_bytes_total{type="gitaly", device="sdb", environment="$environment", stage="main", type="patroni"}[$__interval]) / (419430400)
or
rate(node_disk_written_bytes_total{type="nfs", device="sdb", environment="$environment", stage="main", type="patroni"}[$__interval]) / (419430400)
or
rate(node_disk_written_bytes_total{type="patroni", device="sdb", environment="$environment", stage="main", type="patroni"}[$__interval]) / (838860800)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{environment="$environment", stage="main", type="patroni", component="disk_sustained_write_throughput"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: disk_sustained_write_throughput component saturation: Disk Sustained Write Throughput Saturation per Node

panels.span:
Disk sustained read throughput saturation per node.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    rate(node_disk_read_bytes_total{type="gitaly", device="sdb", environment="$environment", stage="main", type="patroni"}[$__interval]) / (1258291200)
or
rate(node_disk_read_bytes_total{type="nfs", device="sdb", environment="$environment", stage="main", type="patroni"}[$__interval]) / (838860800)
or
rate(node_disk_read_bytes_total{type="patroni", device="sdb", environment="$environment", stage="main", type="patroni"}[$__interval]) / (1258291200)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{environment="$environment", stage="main", type="patroni", component="disk_sustained_read_throughput"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: disk_sustained_read_throughput component saturation: Disk Sustained Read Throughput Saturation per Node

panels.span:
Postgres connection pool saturation per database node.

Sidekiq maintains it's own pgbouncer connection pool. When this resource is saturated, database operations may
queue, leading to additional latency in background processing.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    (
  pgbouncer_pools_server_active_connections{user="gitlab", environment="$environment", stage="main", type="patroni", database="gitlabhq_production_sidekiq"} +
  pgbouncer_pools_server_testing_connections{user="gitlab", environment="$environment", stage="main", type="patroni", database="gitlabhq_production_sidekiq"} +
  pgbouncer_pools_server_used_connections{user="gitlab", environment="$environment", stage="main", type="patroni", database="gitlabhq_production_sidekiq"} +
  pgbouncer_pools_server_login_connections{user="gitlab", environment="$environment", stage="main", type="patroni", database="gitlabhq_production_sidekiq"}
)
/
on(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, instance) group_left()
sum by (environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, instance) (
  pgbouncer_databases_pool_size{environment="$environment", stage="main", type="patroni", name="gitlabhq_production_sidekiq"}
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{environment="$environment", stage="main", type="patroni", component="pgbouncer_async_pool"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: pgbouncer_async_pool component saturation: Postgres Async (Sidekiq) Connection Pool Saturation per Node

panels.span:
PGBouncer single core saturation per node.

PGBouncer is a single threaded application. Under high volumes this resource may become saturated,
and additional pgbouncer nodes may need to be provisioned.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    sum(
  rate(
    namedprocess_namegroup_cpu_seconds_total{groupname=~"pgbouncer.*", environment="$environment", stage="main", type="patroni"}[1m]
  )
) by (groupname, fqdn, type, tier, stage, environment)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{environment="$environment", stage="main", type="patroni", component="pgbouncer_single_core"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: pgbouncer_single_core component saturation: PGBouncer Single Core per Node

panels.span:
Postgres sync connection pool saturation per database node.

Web/api/git applications use a separate connection pool to sidekiq.

When this resource is saturated, web/api database operations may queue, leading to unicorn/puma saturation and 503 errors in the web.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    (
  pgbouncer_pools_server_active_connections{user="gitlab", environment="$environment", stage="main", type="patroni", database="gitlabhq_production"} +
  pgbouncer_pools_server_testing_connections{user="gitlab", environment="$environment", stage="main", type="patroni", database="gitlabhq_production"} +
  pgbouncer_pools_server_used_connections{user="gitlab", environment="$environment", stage="main", type="patroni", database="gitlabhq_production"} +
  pgbouncer_pools_server_login_connections{user="gitlab", environment="$environment", stage="main", type="patroni", database="gitlabhq_production"}
)
/
on(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, instance) group_left()
sum by (environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, instance) (
  pgbouncer_databases_pool_size{environment="$environment", stage="main", type="patroni", name="gitlabhq_production"}
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{environment="$environment", stage="main", type="patroni", component="pgbouncer_sync_pool"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: pgbouncer_sync_pool component saturation: Postgres Sync (Web/API) Connection Pool Saturation per Node

panels.span:
Average CPU per Node.

If average CPU is satured, it may indicate that a fleet is in need to horizontal or vertical scaling. It may also indicate
imbalances in load in a fleet.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    avg(1 - rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", environment="$environment", stage="main", type="patroni"}[$__interval])) by (fqdn)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{environment="$environment", stage="main", type="patroni", component="single_node_cpu"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: single_node_cpu component saturation: Average CPU Saturation per Node

panels.description: Number of active connections per node
panels.title: Server Connection Pool Active Connections per Node

panels.description: Shows connection saturation per pgbouncer pool. Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(clamp_max(sum by (database, env, environment, shard, stage, tier, type) (
  pgbouncer_pools_server_active_connections{type="patroni", environment="$environment", user="gitlab", database!="pgbouncer"} +
  pgbouncer_pools_server_testing_connections{type="patroni", environment="$environment", user="gitlab", database!="pgbouncer"} +
  pgbouncer_pools_server_used_connections{type="patroni", environment="$environment", user="gitlab", database!="pgbouncer"} +
  pgbouncer_pools_server_login_connections{type="patroni", environment="$environment", user="gitlab", database!="pgbouncer"}
)
/
sum by (database, env, environment, shard, stage, tier, type) (
  label_replace(
    pgbouncer_databases_pool_size{type="patroni", environment="$environment"},
    "database", "gitlabhq_production_sidekiq", "name", "gitlabhq_production_sidekiq"
  )
)
,1),0)

panels.title: Connection Saturation per Pool

panels.description: Shows connection saturation per pgbouncer pool, per pgbouncer node. Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(clamp_max(sum by (database, env, environment, fqdn, job, shard, stage, tier, type) (
  pgbouncer_pools_server_active_connections{type="patroni", environment="$environment", user="gitlab", database!="pgbouncer"} +
  pgbouncer_pools_server_testing_connections{type="patroni", environment="$environment", user="gitlab", database!="pgbouncer"} +
  pgbouncer_pools_server_used_connections{type="patroni", environment="$environment", user="gitlab", database!="pgbouncer"} +
  pgbouncer_pools_server_login_connections{type="patroni", environment="$environment", user="gitlab", database!="pgbouncer"}
)
/
sum by (database, env, environment, fqdn, job, shard, stage, tier, type) (
  label_replace(
    pgbouncer_databases_pool_size{type="patroni", environment="$environment"},
    "database", "gitlabhq_production_sidekiq", "name", "gitlabhq_production_sidekiq"
  )
)
,1),0)

panels.title: Connection Saturation per Pool per Node

panels.description: Total aggregated time spend waiting for a backend connection. Lower is better

targets.expr: sum by (database, environment, type) (rate(pgbouncer_stats_client_wait_seconds{type="patroni", environment="$environment", database!="pgbouncer"}[$__interval]) / on() group_left() (vector((time() < bool 1588233600) * 1000000) == 1000000 or vector(1)))

panels.title: Total Connection Wait Time

panels.description: Average time spent waiting for a backend connection from the pool. Lower is better

targets.expr:
sum by (database, environment, type, fqdn, job) (rate(pgbouncer_stats_client_wait_seconds{type="patroni", environment="$environment", database!="pgbouncer"}[$__interval]) / on() group_left() (vector((time() < bool 1588233600) * 1000000) == 1000000 or vector(1)))
/
sum by (database, environment, type, fqdn, job) (rate(pgbouncer_stats_sql_transactions_pooled_total{type="patroni", environment="$environment", database!="pgbouncer"}[$__interval]))

panels.description: Lists saturated resources that are breaching their soft SLO thresholds at this instant

styles.linkTooltip: Click the link to review the past 1 day(s) history for this saturation point.
Click the link to find issues on GitLab.com related to this saturation point.

panels.title: Currently Saturated Resources

panels.description: Lists saturated resources that, given their current value and weekly variance, have a high probability of breaching their soft thresholds limits within the next few hours

styles.linkTooltip: Click the link to review the past 7 day(s) history for this saturation point.
Click the link to find issues on GitLab.com related to this saturation point.

panels.title: Resources Currently at Risk of being Saturated

panels.description: Lists saturated resources that, given their growth rate over the the past week, and their weekly variance, are likely to breach their soft thresholds limits in the next 14d

styles.linkTooltip: Click the link to review the past 30 day(s) history for this saturation point.
Click the link to find issues on GitLab.com related to this saturation point.

panels.title: Resources Forecasted to be at Risk of Saturation in 14d

panels.description: Resource saturation levels for saturation components for this service. Lower is better.
panels.title: Long-term Resource Saturation

panels.description: Percentage of time that resource is within capacity SLOs. Higher is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      gitlab_component_saturation:ratio:avg_over_time_1w{
        type="patroni",
        environment="$environment",
        stage=~"main|"
      }
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: Long-term Resource Saturation - Rolling 1w average trend

panels.content:
graph TD
  subgraph db
  patroni
end

targets.expr:
clamp_max(
  max by (type) (max_over_time(gitlab_service_errors:ratio{env="$environment", environment="$environment", monitor="global", stage="$stage"}[$__interval]))
  or
  sum by (type) (gitlab_service_errors:ratio{environment="$environment", monitor!~"global|", stage="$stage"}),
  1
)

panels.title: System Diagram (Keyed by Error Rates)

panels.content:
graph TD
  subgraph db
  patroni
end

targets.expr:
min by (type) (min_over_time(gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{env="$environment", environment="$environment", monitor="global", stage="$stage"}[$__range]))
or
min by (type) (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{environment="$environment", monitor!~"global|", stage="$stage"})

panels.title: System Diagram (Keyed by Apdex/Latency Scores)
